alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:06PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Areas of Slippery Travel Expected This Evening... A band of light to moderate snow with visibilities below 1 mile at times will impact the North Country through 9 PM. As the sun sets areas of slippery travel may develop, especially across the higher terrain of the Northern Adirondack Mountains and portions of central, northern, and eastern Vermont, including the Northeast Kingdom. Conditions should improve as snowfall tapers off and temperatures slowly climb above freezing by midnight. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Snow covered and icy roads are possible...producing hazardous travel conditions. If you must travel, please use caution.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
